long_desc.thetext: Currently, the Source Page of a sample is read-only. Allow it to be edited and the changes be applied to the Demo Page, so people can play with the source code and immediately watch the effects.

Just a few thoughts:
I've tried to implement it with document.open()/write()/close(), but the problems encountered were:
- FF seems not to execute the links to external files, particularly "<script src=...>" tags; being a qooxdoo app this results in "qx not defined" errors.
- The src attribute of the Iframe is not usable in FF anymore after the edit; you get an "ns*" DOM error.
It's questionable whether other techniques like "<body>.innerHtml = ..." are more usable.
(It would be great to deploy the normal load mechanism of the Iframe using a "string://..." URL scheme ;).
Once this issue has been solved, we also need a "Save As" facilty for the changed source.

Just found http://www.w3schools.com/CSS/tryit.asp?filename=trycss_border-width which implements this editing/viewing of code on the fly in the browser
Hugh
Long grown priorities normalized to P5 to increase a few of them afterwards.
This is solved by the playground application added in 0.8.1

Actually, this was a bug for the *Demobrowser*, not a general "find a means to edit some arbitrary source code in some arbitrary environment". I dont't think this serves the Demobrowser well to neglect this issue, unless we give up on the Demobrowser as an end-user-facing explorative application. This at least has to be clarified before closing this bug as WONTFIX.
I'll look into this, also since I could imagine a pragmatic solution.
This was actually resolved with qooxdoo 1.0 by introducing the feature to "send" a demobrowser app to the playground and continue with edit-and-apply.
Closed all bugs already shipped with a release.
